text: They are AWESOME!!! Easy to work with and extremely helpful!!

name: Victor Burlingame
text: Glad to be out of our storage unit here. We were lured in with a move-in special that was never the price they promised. Then they promised a referral payment to the person that referred us that also never happened. we signed up several days early before needing the unit and told them we needed it ready by Sunday when we had planned on moving all our equipment in... well Sunday arrived, we had 4 guys and two trucks of equipment ready to be unloaded except they still had their company lock on our unit and wouldn't answer their phone, not even the emergency number. We had continued issues with billing and of course now that we informed them we had moved out, they said they couldn't do anything about the billing issues and hung up on us. Their excuse was the number of units they had made it confusing. ok, it's weird that you can't handle taking a payment that you have a contract stating once a month. I have pretty basic storage needs but wow, this place ended up being more trouble than it was worth and we pid more than we were supposed to every month. Just go to the place down the street to Smith Store-it, Ryland mini storage, or any of the dozen other places that can handle your business professionally

resp.text:
Effective this week, we are under new management.

Victor, we are sincerely sorry for the events that took place with your move-in and any other items.  With respect to your billing issues we are unaware of what issues you are referring too... simply put, your card did not process. I would love to discuss this with you further and see what can be done to make it up to you.  Our managers strive to take care of all of our customers.   Customer care and service is of most importance to us. We value all of our customers and always strive to offer the best service and response to our customers.   Please contact us and we are anxious to discuss further to alleviate any of your concerns.

Sincerely, Ownership

text:
I called to get a vehicle towed and the first lady was nice, but another female in the background  was yelling and got on the phone, She would not let me explain i was having MY vehicle towed to my office. Very unprofessional.:
updated Your response is not correct in regard to that phone call The business was identified in the beginning of the conversation and your female associate was the only rude one. Had she stopped yelling I would have explained that that was fine but my personal vehicle also needed towing from a different location.

resp.text: We don’t do any Repo’s at all, someone in your office was trying to pull one over on us, acting like it was a normal tow which it was not… they failed to say it was a repo and then they got a attitude when we told them we don’t do them and if we did it would cost more than a regular local tow.

text:
This company has been around for awhile and continue to hire new people. I never understood why they had such a high turn out until this year. The manager/owner has an absolutely terrible attitude with his staff. I don't care how cheap a business is if they treat the employees like this I will do my best to avoid them. I've personally witnessed his angry attitude while waiting to pick up my truck from a wreck. When you run a business your employees make it efficient. Without good employees you can't have a great business.

I wrote this for my grandpa, he is over 80 and asked me to help him.

resp.text: I hate you feel this way but 99% of the time when we hire new people Is because we are growing and buying more trucks so yes there is a lot of new people   And I like to hear more about this wreck your talking about call us so we can understand more what you are even talking about 256 571 7397

name: Shirlee Bailey
text:
This company was used by my insurance roadside assistants. They said that because I had All-State insurance they were not putting me first because All-State doesn't pay well. That tells me that it's not about who is in need of help, but how our insurance pays them. I sat on the road for almost 6 hours with 3 kids.
When I called the place in which my car was to be towed, they said it was never delivered.
My vehicle was still sitting on the road even after I was sent a text saying it would be picked up at 4:37-4:52, only it was moved about 600 feet to where we initially stopped. The kids built a pyramid of rocks while playing in the ditch, which was approximately 600 feet to where the car was. Which tells me they loaded it then put it back down. WHY IN THE WORLD WOULD YOU DO THAT? Never again.

resp.text: This was on a very busy day, we told this potential client that we would get to her once we were finished with the calls that had come in earlier. She demanded that we get to her first and after some very uncomfortable phone calls we decided that we did not want to do business with said potential client. We informed the roadside insurance of this decision.

name: Michelle Smith
text: If you want to be talked over when trying to speak or talked rude to this is the company to use. I called them to explain something just like my insurance company asked me to do. Jason was very rude telling me I shouldn’t even be dealing with him only my insurance company should call him. First off its our vehicle and I’ll call all I need to about it especially when instructed to do so by my insurance company. I was belittled and talked to rudely. Our company will not use them again. We also requested our truck be dropped off at home 3 miles from the accident. He said oh no let me take it to my lot so the insurance company will come out faster. Which we let him do and it cost us $2800.00 because they didn’t come out faster and it sat there from 6/26-8/21. I’ll say the lady in the office was always nice when I spoke with her but Jason who I believe is the owner has no customer service skills. When someone calls to ask about their vehicle you should be willing to answer any questions they have and be nice about it regardless if they have their insurance company involved or not. Especially when you’re telling me a different story then my insurance adjuster told me minutes before I called you.

resp.text: This was not a issue on Ace Towing this was matter of insurance wasn’t notified properly, and when they did come we had to do what they told us to do, we strive daily to help and be reliable to ALL our customers. Thanks

name: John Lohin
text: Sharon called me and told me she has a 2020 dry van trailer available. I specifically wanted a 2020 year. She told me she needed a deposit to keep the trailer for me. I sent it to her. She sent me papers to sign for a 2019 trailer, I asked her about it and she kept saying it’s the accounting mistake. They changed the papers to show the year 2020. Before my loan closing, I called her and asked her what’s the company’s name exactly so my bank could make the cashiers check. After I finalized my loan she sent me a bill of sale for a 2019 trailer. I called her and she says it is definitely a 2019. The accounting keeps making a mistake. How did they change my papers to show 2020 from the first place? She told me she could give me $400 off. I said no thanks. I’m not going to pay the same money for a 2019, when a 2019 is a few thousand cheaper than a 2020. Sharon wasn’t honest from the beginning.

text: Was a VERY difficult ordeal to return a uhaul rented elsewhere but designated for drop off here. When renting I was told I had til Tuesday to drop off. name: Kayla Lisenby
text: This was such a HORRID experience! If you have the option, DO NOT use Budget Truck Rental, and IF you are using Budget, DO NOT rent through this location. At least try and find an actual Budget Rental Agency (rather than an independent contractor like this one) -- when I returned this nightmare to the local Budget Agency, the employees were very clear that often independent contractors rent out trucks without regard to their status simply for the money. Our experience was a NIGHTMARE. The truck was FILTHY and DAMAGED when we picked up - including the driver's side door of the cab hanging precariously with the fender flapping about. The agency simply encouraged documentation of existing damage so we would not be charged for it but were told there were no issues and to take the truck, and because we were under time constraints, we took the rental. The experience was miserable - the truck was dirty, LOUD, and dangerous. It was difficult to ensure the driver's side door was safely closed. In addition, when we hit rain during the drive, the ENTIRE CAB STARTED TO LEAK! Thankfully it didn't rain until the last 1.5 hours of the drive, since that time was spent soaking wet and freezing.  When I reached out to Customer Service, they offered a paltry 20% compensation of the base rental fee only ($44.64 offered, $223.20 rental fee) - between the rental, insurance, taxes and fees, and gasoline, we spent over $500 on this HORRID experience. DO NOT USE.

name: Melody Kernan
text: WHATEVER YOU DO - do not reserve a truck here!!!! You will not get it!! We made a reservation over 2 weeks ago and were called 2 days before our move saying they did not have a truck. Being graduation weekend, there are no more in tuscaloosa. A disgusting company that I'm sorry we ever tried to do business with.

name: Julianna Ducker
text: DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS MAN! We booked a truck online because the company said that one was available, and of course their knowledge of his truck availability is based on what he tells them. The truck pick up was scheduled for Saturday morning, at 3:42PM Friday afternoon (just over an hour before closing) he TEXTS us saying that no truck is available, not even the decency to call! We drove out there to talk this problem through with him. He never is in the shop, but expects people to call as the only means of contact. He did answer that call and told us the same thing again, would not even meet us in person. The next day the credit card was charged for a no-show fee! He told us there were no trucks available and refused to give us more help than a U-haul number, and still had the audacity to charge us for not showing up. We DID show up the day before, and we were told there was nothing and no reason to come back in the morning! After seeing the card charge I again went out to the shop, where he again wasn't. He ignored 5 phone calls, a voice message, and a text. Only just after I left (I'm fairly sure he watched me drive away), did he call back and claimed that he had nothing to do with the charge. Maybe a plausible excuse, except there is no way for the company to think we did not show up without his contacting them. Even if they somehow charged the no-show fee another way, it was certainly on him to contact the company that he works under to tell them that he had no trucks to give. DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS MAN! ZERO STARS.

name: beaucult
text: This is by far the worst truck rental company I have ever rented from. There should be an option for negative stars because they don't even deserve the one. The owner of this location had nothing ready when I arrived to pick up the truck for a 1700 mile move. He would not even turn the truck around in his junk piled lot. When I went to hook up the auto trailer I rented, the wires were cut and didn't connect to the back of the truck. His solution, twist the wires together to another harness which was cut off another trailer. Very lazy and rude man who has no concern for the customers' safety. This faulty trailer ended up preventing me from leaving on time and caused me an injury. Oh they replaced it after I had my truck loaded but it ended up preventing me from starting my new job on time and then cost me 800 more dollars which this pathetic company called budget charged me for "late" drop off at the destination. This joke of a truck rental company cost me over $2,000 extra and offered no compensation for the malfunctioning truck and trailer they rented me. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY NOR THIS JOKE LOCATION/ OWNER! YOU WILL SUFFER FOR THEIR INEPTITUDE AND LAZINESS!!!

name: Nuri Ceylan
text: No service no help no no no no no nothing how doo you stay in business like this

name: Jack Obitts
text: I rented a one way 16 foot truck from Alabama to my new home in Florida. The price was an especially good value since I received unlimited mileage during my three day rental. The truck was clean, drove well, and had excellent visibility toward the rear of the vehicle. The Budget truck store owner had my truck ready for pickup at 9:00 am and all I had to do (besides the paperwork), was perform an inspection of the vehicle for any pre-existing damage. But just in case, I purchased the supplementary insurance for covering any vehicle damage during the rental period which was a bit pricey but it gave me a comfortable feeling for a long July 4th weekend run of 235 miles.  By the way, one of the other big truck rental companies only was going to provide a two day rental with limited mileage that would just barely cover the full trip.  So, any route deviation would have resulted in additional expense. And the other rental truck company wanted me to pick up their truck at a location 70 miles from my home!! My only issue for my Budget rental involved a seriously soiled furniture pad which couldn't be used. The other 11 were fine. My turn-in at the Budget rental site in Florida was as I expected - no additional surprises or fees. I will use and recommend Budget for future rentals.

name: Chatting Mrs. Mason
text: My husband and I rented a truck to reload our of state. This has been the worst experience EVER!!! Traveling with my elderly mother, two dogs and being diabetic is stress enough our moving truck broke down hours outside of town.  They sent a repair person hours later and were after a three hour assessment were we’re allowed to go to a hotel. The next morning they towed the truck with our items to a shop to sit for the next day or two. We asked repeatedly to have another vehicle but we’re told that it was not approved. This truck mother board was damaged and had something put in the tank that should not have been placed in it. The truck will take days or a week to be services. I don’t think we should have to be subjected to staying in a hotel for days until they can fix a broken truck. Giving customers a proper running vehicle should be the standard.

name: Deanna Ezell Hallman
text: Great people with great service at this location. I would definitely use them again.

name: Zach Harrison
text: We wish we had read these reviews before. The same thing that happened to several others happened to us. The truck was reserved a week in advance and when it came time to be picked up, there wasn’t one available. Not there or anywhere else. We ended up having to take a truck 10 feet smaller than wanted, and it had 2 check engine lights on. Go somewhere else.

name: Frances Camille Ray
text: Dishonest/Scammers. The Budget website says the liability insurance is optional, but the person there kept insisting it was 'mandatory' and so upped the price 80$. Sad!

name: Victoria Means
text: I feel like if you don't have trucks to rent, why would you have people wasting their time making reservations. This location had no trucks and the workers told me to contact customers service because they didn't know what to tell me. Unprofessional AF!

name: Stephanie Higgs
text: if I could give negative stars I would. READ THE REVIEWS AND BEWARE IF YOU RENT/TRY TO RENT FROM HERE

name: Happy Mommy
text: This has been a terrible experience.  I reserve a truck ten days ahead of my move. This guy calls me the day before my move saying he has no truck.  Moving was quite the challenge, as you can guess.  Then I was still charged $50 on my card as a no show, even though he called me telling me there was no truck available for rental.  I'm still bickering with customer service on this one. I feel like I should be paid for all the legwork I'm doing to get my $50 returned to me.

name: Beverly Chandler
text: Very nice gentleman who rented us our Budget truck.   Definitely would rent from him again.

resp.text: We're so glad to hear this, Beverly Chandler! Thank you for choosing Budget Truck - we hope to rent with you again soon!

name: Brian Yanko
text: Budget itself is a great company to deal with but I will never use this location again. The guy there recommends a Shell up the road for fuel which if you use that Shell the lot is off level to begin with. Fueled the trucked, to the brim even had a little some out. Go to drop off the truck and the guy tells me it's not full and He's going to charge another 30 to fill it up. I've had my CDL for 15 years run tractors, heavy equipment, I took my driving test in a Deuce and a half but I guess I don't know how to operate a fuel pump at this point or the one mile drive ate all of it. STAY AWAY from this location. Take the extra time to rent or drop off somewhere else. What a joke

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear this, Brian. Please call us at 1.800.462.8343 to discuss this further so we can look into it.

name: Emilee Mann
text: Charged us $267 for a 8 hour rental and refused to send me a final receipt! NEVER GO HERE! When we were pre authorized for $84.99

name: Billy Dotson
text: Made a reservation almost three weeks ago and an hour before picking up they call and tell me there are none available and to add on a Saturday. I've called penski uhaul and nothing is available and now have to call the land lord for an extra day and reschedule an interview because nothing is available. If there was an option for zero stars I'd click that. The worst experience I've ever had.

resp.text: We're so sorry for the inconvenience, Billy. Please call us at 1.800.462.8343 so we can look into this and assist you further.

name: John Paul Whitmore
text: Horrible customer service. I reserved a truck from them 3 days in advance and made a deposit. I was specifically told if i did so that I was guaranteed a truck. When I called the day before I was due to pick it up I was told they only had 2 trucks and 5 people wanting to rent. 3 people had applied online after I had made my reservstion and they promised the same trucks to multiple people.

name: stephen patrias
text: I called to make sure he had my reservation (12 foot truck). He said he had it ready to go.  When i got there,  he told me all he had was a 16 foot truck that looked like it was about to break down.  Thankfully,  i made my 1300 mile trip.  I will not do business with this location again.

resp.text: We're so sorry to hear about this experience, stephen patrias. Please call us at 1.800.462.8343 to discuss this further so we can provide you with further assistance.

name: Shavawn Goley
text: Second time I've used this location and both experiences the same representative had an attitude and came off as unapproachable. I will go out of my way to not use them again.

resp.text: We're so sorry to hear this, Shavawn Goley! Please call us at 1.800.462.8343 to discuss this further so we can provide you with assistance.

name: Terry Schultz
text: Friendly oriented and very helpful

name: Chuck Wood
text: Good service great bunch of people

name: Frank Reaves
text: This particular Ryder location even when busy go above and beyond to help get me back on the road as quickly as possible. And this has been on multiple occasions. Nothing but awesome things to say about the people here.

name: David Osborne
text: Top notch. From Sales and Leasing to the mechanics and especially the drivers all employees are professional and courteous and tops in their field

name: TruckerGitty
text: Excellent repair shop. They really try hard to make the driver HAPPY. Could clean bathrooms and stock toilet paper and make driver lounge more comfortable and add portapottys outside for drivers having to wait overnight for a repair. And a washer and dryer so I can do laundry while I'm getting repaired. And WiFi would be nice!

name: Fakhriddin Yunusov
text: Very bad place and rough employers..im never come back this Ryder truck rental office

name: J Crow
text: Was in and out in no time

name: Steven Poynter
text: Truck rental services

name: David Lowry
text: They got trucks

name: Cortney Powell
text: Definitely recommend for storage. Climate controlled. Nice. Clean.

name: clAy bguil
text: Danielle is great helps you any way she can love doing business with them

name: Dan F
text:
Circumstance:  Dropped off a one-way rental truck that got damaged during our move.

In short, this went well and was painless.  Damage wasn't major and didn't render the truck unusable, so that was good.  The guy I dealt with (don't know his name, unfortunately) was cool about it, and from walk in to walk out, it was maybe 10 minutes.

Good experience overall.  Not sure if the guy helping me was new since the not-so-good reviews I read but I didn't experience anything but a friendly guy who was pretty laid back and has a good sense of humor.

Side note:  Cool Pawn Shop, not what I'm used to seeing.  Not jam-packed with junk.  Need to go back and look at some of the stuff closer.  Might be a couple of purchases in my future.

name: Jonathon Knight
text: I didn't have any issues picking up or returning a uhaul truck at this location. Did everything online and a friendly guy brought my out my key. Convienent location, will use again.

name: Scott Kemp
text: Very rude and not very helpful employees at this location. Rented truck online, they had no clue how to help me with the uhaul rental. The store is open until 5pm the sign says but I walked back into the store for help, the girl at the counter closed the door and locked up at 3:45pm. Two of the Tires on the truck I rented were low and borderline flat, truck very dirty. Poorly run business, do not recommend.

name: Morgan Ozenbaugh
text: Wanted to rent a truck but they said they only want to rent for short trips in case the trucks break down. Ill have to find somewhere else. Girl at the counter didnt want to give me any options when i told her i wanted to move two hours away and just looked at her cell phone the whole time we were talking.

name: LongHaulFishing CO
text: The owner had no clue what was going on inside or outside his store. Very rude and cussed at his employees in front of everyone at the store. Great products, terrible service.

name: Lanore Smith
text: Very friendly, helpful employees. We ended up using them 2 times.

name: Aprilmayorjune Usrey
text: Large selection, even on a last minute decision to rent.   Very helpful with insurance  needs.   I would recommend Bama Auto Rental to anyone needing to rent an automobile.

name: Arthur Fuller
text: Great deal, easy and fast check in and check out. Appreciate the friendly service!

name: T
text:
Do not EVER use this place. Dropped my super small car off to get detailed (JUST ON THE INSIDE). They charged me $125 when I was never given a price quote.

I have friends and family who use this place and I’ve never heard them pay more than $50.

I picked my car up and there was dirt on the ceiling where there wasn’t before. HORRIBLE experience. Save yourself some money and frustration and go elsewhere.

name: David Donahue
text: Never ever come here, they have no concept of the world outside

name: Glen F.
text: Very friendly; Check-in was a breeze. We were on the road in no time. Highly recommend!

name: Tabitha Bower
text: They were terrible they double-charged me and they refuse to fix it I would not recommend this place

name: Athanastia Gerontakis
text: Keep your money

name: Delaney Gibbs
text: Incredibly rude, horrible customer service, & the woman is one of the rudest people I’ve ever met. I’ve worked in a customer service job for over 15 years & I have NO idea how the business part of this is still open. Rent from U-haul but rent anywhere but here!

name: Andrew Dorough
text: Uhaul reeked of smoke and had a piece of broken furniture left in it. A $29.95 truck and $0.80 a mile after a 12 mile trip through town came out to $80 after all the hidden fees and charges that were never explained or disclosed. Got charged a $15 gas fee after going 12 MILES. Don’t do business with these people unless you like wasting your money.

name: Matt D
text: Got completely ripped off using a dirty, nasty uhaul. Terrible customer service. This place is a complete joke.

name: sam grimes
text: Awful

name: Scott Suttle
text: Country store... Carries a good selection of necessities..

name: Kayla Charniaux
text: Had to wait an hour because the worker was “tired.” I counted at least 20 customers she let in front of us because the cigarette sells were obviously more important. Literally wasted our Saturday. Won’t be back.

name: Brandy Lusk
text: Horrible experience was over charged and they refused to refund

name: Maria De Jesus
text: Great service

name: Jonathan Hicks
text: Charged an extra $68.00 to my credit card because they close at 3pm everyday.

name: Terxs
text: Nice people and fix a small leak in my tire quick!

name: James Jordan
text: if I could give a negative 5 star rating I would. Place absolutely sucks.

name: Tiffany Gibson
text: As we were in the way to the beach my tire light came on, these people were so kind and Fast, I had 4 kids in the car, 1 of whom was autistic. They got me checked out and back on the road. Highly recommend

name: K Bradley
text:
#LAWKHAII 's Viewpoint: IVY Greetings,

Gr8 customer service and friendly communications with options regarding the availability of TIREs  !!

name: Jurone Daniels
text: Great people very helpful and their work is high quality and they will not try to fix something if it's not needed and u can bring your own parts the technician is very knowledgeable i highly recommend Axis Tires they do more than tires stop by give them a try you will be very satisfied.. 5 Start shop..

name: melissa clark
text:
Very pleased with the service we
received on a Sunday! Very courteous and excellent pricing!! THANK YOU

name: Katie Corley
text: We had our brakes changed in May or June and they began squealing after a month. You would think I needed new ones already even though I don’t drive far very often. The service was fast and the price was good but, I wish I could take these brakes off to see why they are squealing so bad.

name: annitta Martin
text: Steve and his crew always get the job done right.  They are fast, friendly and professional.

resp.text: Thank you!!!! We love our customers!!!!

name: Kitty Prince
text: Love the service. They help you with all things concerned and their mechanics are superb.

name: Tracy Kidd
text: Had repairs done & Bo didn't fix it right the first time so took it back and had to pay for labor a second time. WOW!! Shouldn't have had to pay the labor costs again!!

name: Teddee Jordan
text: Excellent prices and my car was done really quickly, would recommend.

name: Lee Brown
text: Great, fast,pit stop back on the highway

name: J Johnson Law
text: Informative

name: Johnny vernis
text: The guys there are helpful and great

name: gabrielle basco
text: Friendly people great work

name: joseph huggins
text: Great service amazing

name: Bill Wiley
text: Friendly and speedy service.

name: Tom Longbine
text: Good people and fast

name: Stephen Laurendine
text: This place is awesome!  :-)

name: Scotty Barnes
text: Fast good service

name: Derrick Adams
text: I paid $760 for a set of tires 4 months ago they wouldn't honor my warranty and I had the receipt to prove it buy from someone else not here

resp.text: Hi Derrick, you told me that there was a chunk missing from your because you hit a pothole. Unfortunately, that's not covered by the manufacturer's defect or treadwear warranties. I'm sorry that you had a bad experience, but we strive to provide the best customer service available anywhere. Thanks, Steve.

name: Paul Marsh
text: Great people.

name: darren walker
text: Had a steel piece of metal in my tire. Was near closing time, but Steve took care of the problem

name: Terrance Dickinson
text: Good service

name: P Turner
text: Fast service

name: ROB MCDONALD
text: Hard workers

name: Eric Hill
text: Good

name: D Silent 1
text: This location is easy to see from the road and easy to access.  There is a service garage operating on the premise so you can get vehicle service too.

name: Dusty Gold
text: They were extremely helpful couldn't ask for anything

name: Eddie J
text: These people are INCREDIBLE!!!!  I had to drive down from TN to get my Dad and his truck to haul back home.  They went above and beyond to help.  I can't say enough how AMAZING they are!!!!!

name: Aaron Browning
text: Guess I needed a truck to move stuff

name: MsSouthernSlang
text: Helpful and nice fellow. Sorted out the the mess another local dealer made. Super nice man! Very impressive. Will go straight to him next time.

name: Dennis Mc
text: Understaffed location. The employees do a good job but are rushed trying to help everyone. This also causes long waits at times.

name: Sabas Ck
text: Rent with them

name: James Love
text: Great movers

name: Danielle Bruce
text: Accommodating friendly service when turning in U-HAUL.

name: David Warren
text: There is a muscular guy with a light beard. Dude, you don't belong there. Crawl back into your mommy's basement. Stay there, don't ever come out. This world is better off without you.

name: David Allain
text:
Started my journey with renting a UHAUL truck and trailer two weeks before the move. Megan was very knowledgeable and helped me make the right truck size choice. Unfortunately, the uhaul reservation system was down that day so I reserved from home later that week.

For some reason the “traffic” division of UHAUL that is not based in Auburn changed my reservation the day before and I was going to have to go to Phoenix City to pick up a truck, and Opelika to pick up the trailer. Ended up working with Hunter King and Hugh three times in one day, the day before the rental pickup date, to iron out my issues.

Hunter gave the info for traffic try and get it sorted out, which eventually did work. There wasn’t anything he could do to add my reservation to the store because they were out of truck. By an act of God someone canceled later and I got the truck I needed at this location. Then “traffic” moved it again..

Needless to say. Hunter K. was knowledgeable, patient, and extremely helpful in getting the reservation squared away again and even helped add an extra day to my reservation so I could get the truck immediately.

11/10 recommend this store because of the employees Megan, Hunter K., and Hugh.

I say everything here to show you how much of a hassle it can be to reserve online. If you can reserve in-person at this store it will save SOOO many headaches.

War Damn Eagle

name: Tuyen_2000
text: Paperwork got messed up and I got charged for 460 miles instead of the 30 I did. Seem to think it's perfectly fine to do 460 miles in six hours and refuse to refund the couple hundred dollars they overcharged. Just rent a truck, don't come here.

name: joy G
text:
Best service Ever. Megan is the best
She is so friendly and helpful
I would like to give more than 5 stars
Box Truck rental was efficient and well run.
Fast and efficient. Customer service courteous and professional.
Highly recommended

name: Amber K
text: They are the absolute worst! I've never met a set of ruder people in my life. If you can't go to another uhaul location just pick Budget or Penske and save yourself the headache.

name: Jerry F
text: Megan is the best.  Never expected such friendly and incredible service when I needed help moving my son in to college.  Thank you so much for your help Megan.  You made my day and my week easier.  Highly recommend.

name: Nick Britton
text: Super friendly and helpful staff. I had to go into the store multiple times and interacted with several different people. They were all courteous.

name: Mohammadnaser Ansari
text: I had some issues with the truck and the roadside assistance was completely useless. They did not have any service available in Auburn at the time (near downtown). However, the lady in charge of the store was exceptionally helpful (didn't get the name). The only reason I will rent again is only for the great customer service in the store.

name: Pierce M
text: Hunter is a great employee. Super helpful and a good communicator which made renting / returning a breeze.

name: N Stovah
text: Hunter was excellent. Very friendly and knowledgeable. Deserves a big raise.

name: Leonard Sloan
text: Quick fast and easy service

name: Laurie Hillanbrand
text: A No Show. We made a reservation for a Move In date for a Saturday. The woman who took the information said they are no longer open on a Saturday, but she would make the exception for this time. She gave us her personal cell phone number and asked if we would call 15 minutes before arrival and she would meet us to sign the paper work. We did just that, no one picked up, but we left a message. We arrived with a dorm room full of stuff to store for the summer and we called again, no answer. The sign on the door of the office said they were closed but to call the number (her number)AND the national number, which is what we did. The Representative for the national number said the U-HAUL company doesn't allow their storage buildings to close on a Saturday and that they couldn't do more to help us. So while we waited for a return phone call, we started looking at other storage places near by and STOR-EAGLE Storage was able to accommodate us with no problems! At the time of this review it has been almost 5 hours since we left a message at U-HAUL Moving & Storage of Auburn and we still did not get a return phone call. Make a reservation at your own risk.

name: Rachel Sugg
text:
My husband and I chose to use Uhaul for our move because it was the best affordable option. For future moves we will do everything we can to avoid working with them again.

After making a reservation a month in advance, we found that our truck had been double booked and watched it be given to someone else right in front of us. When asked for some kind of alternative or assistance, the man who was supposed to be helping us simply told us, “That’s too bad,” and that we could call the national Uhaul line. Because our state is becoming overwhelmed with COVID-19 cases, we used the Uhaul app to check in and pick up the truck. However, the man helping us said that we should have come inside (where not a single employee was masked) if we wanted the truck. We understand that this situation may not have been this individual’s fault, but his behavior made our situation even more distressing, as he was quite rude, even belligerent, and made no attempt at an apology for this very disruptive mistake.

This mixup has made our lives very difficult, and we were sorely disappointed in the employee’s attitude toward us. In the future, we will not be using Uhaul, and from now on we will be warning others about this.

name: Chelsea Clayton
text: I have rented uhaul trailers before but I have never had an experience like this one! The employees absolutely knocked my socks off!! Brandon, Megan, and Blake have absolutely made this experience the best I have ever had.  I will definitely come back to this location for all my rental needs!!

name: Space Cadet
text: Great service and very friendly. Have dropped off Uhauls twice here in the past month.

name: Corey Harris
text:
We waited in the store for 10 mins until
Someone walked in from the back to help. We did the scan and go on the app, and the man still wanted to verify our items and print a confirmation. Why do scan and go if you have to wait in line anyways?

name: Gopal Nath
text: I reserved 15’ truck.  Before  picking up they assigned me 26’  truck instead,  saying that 15’ not available.

name: Zongru Han
text: Worst service ever, staff is rude and they wouldn’t talk to you for more than 10min

name: Jose Torres
text: Uhaul's online booking system made some major errors on my booking, but I had a ton of time-saving help from the staff at this location. They helped me get the correct size truck for my move.

name: Cal Warriner
text: Could not have been better. Guy behind counter was quick and efficient. Guy who hooked trailer up just as good. In and out in 20 minutes including purchase of wardrobes, tape, boxes and part for hitch.

name: William Paris
text: Megan was very helpful and the store had everything I needed. Thank you. I wasn't expecting such a pleasant experience.

name: James S
text: Unable to complete reservation because "keys were lost by last person to use the van." First, there should be duplicates. Second, I was called the morning I was supposed to move. Why even bother guaranteeing something that is not there? After cancelling my reservation and having me go around town looking for a same-day, 3x more rental, the location did not even tell me about the U-Haul program that gives partial reimbursements for failed guarantees.

name: Paramjit “Perry” Kahai, PhD
text:
The rep who assisted me at this store is a tall, bearded man.  As soon as he handed me the truck, I took a picture of the odometer. On the contract, he had mileage out that was lower than what I saw before I started moving. The mileage out should be the odometer mileage when the truck is handed to the customer, not the mileage that may be on their records when the truck was returned by a previous customer.

Also, unknown to me, there was a dolly in the back that I had not even reserved.  I saw it only when I opened the back to load my stuff.  I was surprised, to say the least and wondered if I will be billed for it. Guess what?  I was billed for it even though I had not used it. And how did he know that I had used it? When I called this morning, he told me that the plastic tab that was attached to the dolly was broken. When I try to assure him that I had not even touched the dolly, his response was rude and something like "we have a lot of customers who say they didn't use the dolly but they actually did." In short, he had just accused me of lying!  My question is: why was the dolly even there in the first place? I had not reserved it!  And if there was something in the back of the truck, he should have opened the back and shown it to me.  I would have asked for the dolly to be taken out. Further, how do I know that tab wasn't broken before the truck keys were handed to me? So, this was a clear case of an attempt to cheat a customer.  I wonder how many people this store rep has cheated.  Next time, if I ever rent again from this location (which I very much doubt) or any other, I will make certain to open the back and have them remove any extra stuff I did not order!

Any attempts at talking with the rep over the phone was met with rude, curt, and insulting responses.  The phone call was recorded by the location, so that will provide evidence of whether I am telling the truth about the rep's attitude and lack of respect towards me.

BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU RENT A TRUCK AT THIS LOCATION. INSPECT EVERYTHING BEFORE YOU LEAVE AND HAVE THEM REMOVE EVERYTHING YOU HAD NOT RESERVED.

name: Shari Belton
text: The General Manager greets you at the door. I had a reservation to pick up a trailer for my son and later found out it wasn't needed. The store was able to refund my money within two days, even though I purchased a one-way rental. Be sure to stop by there for all of your rental needs!

name: John Parker
text: Without a doubt, the most unprofessional outfit of workers I've ever witnessed behind a single desk. My sister went into the store to complete the very routine process of accessing her storage unit. However, unbeknownst to her or anyone else, they were full and instead rerouted her reservation to Georgia. This information was not even gathered until they second attempt to receive help from the desk, for the first time we spoke to their general manager, Tavon Scott, who was at the moment in no mood to do his job. As soon as he saw that our last name did not come up in the computer, he looked at us as if we were crazy and then proceeded to profusely rid himself of all blame ("it was the call center") and yelled at us for becoming frustrated at the fact that we seemingly had no storage. He was completely unwilling to make up for the fault of his company in any capacity and did nothing but sit there and act annoyed at our frustration. I dropped by one last time to use the restroom and I could hear them quoting us and laughing at our situation until they saw I had come in. I was so disgusted at their attitude about their job that I marched up to the desk to get Mr. Scott's full name to write in this report, to which he replied, laughing "You can just look up my name if you need it." I replied "take care" and he replied "oh I will take care" and continued to murmur something under his breath to the amusement of his coworkers. I've never held an official job to this date, but if I talked half as rudely to any customer as they did to us, I'd expect to be canned on the spot, and that's exactly what I wish upon this man, Mr. Scott. I'd equate this crew to a group of shiftless, gawky teenagers who are too immature to own up to their own shortcomings. Simply put, these insolent fools don't know how to represent a company and don't appreciate the name stitched onto their shirt. They've made a decision to be bad at what they do. One star for knowing English.

name: Mark Gallagher
text: My reserved trailer was rented to another person which sent it over 90 miles away.   However, since we all remained calm; they worked with us and gave us a 17 foot truck which worked out so much better than a small trailer.  It had better gas milage, great air conditioning, and we didn't need to pay extra for a logistical error.  Thanks guys at Auburn U-Haul for making my move stress free and helping out even though you really didn't need to....

name: Christopher Abreu
text: I had reserved a truck a month in advance, only to have it redirected from this location to another 45 minutes away the day before my move. They claim they were “overbooked”, even though they confirmed the reservation to me over the phone earlier in the week, and was not updated online until after the email. Calling the office takes you to their call center, where you either get someone that is willing to help or someone that hangs up on you. I would not recommend bringing your business here, as the overall experience was unprofessional, sloppy, and infuriating.

name: Whitney Mullins
text: I reserved a self-storage climate control unit with U-Haul on February 1st. I kept the email confirmation and went by to make sure everything was in order so my roommate could begin moving their stuff into storage. After twenty minutes of waiting in line I showed them the email and asked how to go about getting access to the unit since I had never done this before. The man looked up everything and said I was nowhere in the system. I showed him the confirmation and everything that was needed and he said he was sorry, but there was nothing he could do. The manager came out and said that they have not had the climate control storage for over two months now. I told him I have had the unit reserved since February and received no notice that anything was changed. I even called two days ago checking to make sure and the lady said everything was fine. I asked them if they could help me out because I had to find somewhere to put the items because I have to be moved out by noon tomorrow and cannot move into my new place until August 15. They said they could not help me and turned me away. I will never use the company of U-Haul again. There was only one storage unit available in the city of Auburn, and it was at Uncle Bob's storage. The only reason they had it available was because someone cancelled an hour before I called. Thank goodness for that.

name: Randy Mauldin
text:
I rented a 26' truck today. You double billed my credit card. I should have known that you were a disreputable business when Michael asked me for my credit card without quoting me a price. Since you are a monopoly I guess you think that people will pay any amount of money to rent a truck.
He then quoted me a price which I agreed to. I found out when I picked up the truck that he conveniently failed to tell me that there is a hidden fee of $0.99 a mile. WOW, now you have added $80 in hidden fees.
I started to cancel the reservation but then I remembered that you are the only place that rents moving equipment. I had to move so I was stuck with the extortion.
Since you are greedy bastards, you decide to go ahead and stick it to me. You double billed my credit card to make up for the frustration of dealing with an unhappy customer.
Rest assured that this isn't the end of the case. I will contact my credit card company and I will make sure that all of the milage charge is reversed as well as the double billing. When you quote a price, you must honor it.

name: Casten FIscher
text: I use this place frequently to get trailers for hauling things.  They usually have the trailers I need, and they are usually quick to get me in and out.  I have been to other uhaul centers who are not helpful at all, so it is refreshing to go here.

name: Gullatte Acres
text: I dropped off a trailer and had excellent service.

name: Elliott Wood
text: Staff doesn't know squat about their products. The lady on the phone said i would need to buy transmission fluid for my trailer hitch. Recommend a different dealer.

name: nicole gathe
text: Brad was great! He got us in and out when we picked up and returned. No issues with prices or quotes. A+

name: Jared Hawsey
text: Rented a trailer and they were very nice and quick. In and out in a flash

name: Jerrell Knight
text: Worst customer experience I EVER had. Customer service rep did not want to do his job and tried to stale so he wouldn't have to do his job.

name: Andypatt43
text: Went into store to get wiring for my trailer hitch.  After about 30 mins and no employees in the store to help the 5-7 people that had accumulated behind me in line.  When the guy came back out to help me he said I must talk to installation tech.  When the tech came out bout 10 mins later he proceeds to tell me that I can't make a reservation in the store I had to do it on-line.(just to get me out if store I think).     After calling customer care they told me this was absurd u must make appointment in store.  So long story short their a bunch of lazy people that wanna do nothing.  They also told me that it would take an hour, but the service rep on phone said 4 hours and would be $210.00 plus parts and wire.   Called CTU(CUSTOM TRUCKS UNLIMITED) RIGHT up the street and they install for $125.00 parts and all.  Never ever using these morons again. name: Kristi Sears
text:
On January 18th we purchased a 2011 International 4300 that was a “verified” used vehicle from Ryder Vehicle Sales LLC. I’ll use that term lightly. It had 156,627 miles the day of purchase. We drove to Knoxville, TN for pick up. Upon arrival the gentleman helping couldn’t answer a single question about said truck. All he could tell us is that if we find a problem, to document on said form (within 72 hours) and they would have warranty fix any “necessary” repairs. On the way home, we realized a few things that I would consider to be necessary repairs. 1. The air brakes were leaking air. Now for those of you that don’t know, the ONLY brakes in this truck is the air brakes. It depends on a secure unit to stop this MASSIVE truck. 2. The air bags, similar to your shocks, were also faulty. This causing the body of the truck to bounce onto the frame without any cushion. 3. The check engine light came on. We immediately pulled over (20 ish miles from pick up location, they were closed so we couldn’t go back) and called the salesman and let him know. He filled out the form with the concerns and sent it in. A few days later￼ we received a call from warranty to allow us to take said vehicle to the repair shop in Madison Alabama. They kept the truck for almost a week waiting on parts to fix the brakes, air bags, an O2 sensor, and back up camera. Once they had completed the repairs they called for us to pick up the truck. We picked up the “fixed” truck only to get a few miles (4.7) down the road and the check engine light came on again. We again called warranty and spoke to Heather Upchurch. She agreed for the truck to be returned to the mechanic. About 2 weeks later they called to say it was complete. Again, we go to pick up the truck. This time on the way home (Hazel Green from Madison) the truck started smoking like crazy from under the cab. Immediately we contacted the Manager of Sales, David Preston. We reported this to him and sent videos of the smoking engine. He directed us to call Warranty again. This time Heather agreed for us to take it to Southland Trucking as they are a licensed and certified International Dealer. (They are awesome y’all!). Immediately they found that the windshield that Ruder installed was never glued into place, the DPS filer was completely deteriorated, the DOC filer was completely stopped up, there was an excessive fuel leak, and a bad exhaust sensor. They reported the diagnostics to Ryder Warranty.
Warranty called the next day, and Heather stated out of the 5200.00 repairs, Ryder would pay 1/2. Now y’all know me pretty well...that didn’t fly. Eventually they agreed to pay for everything EXCEPT the fuel leak. They sent a paper for us to sign if we wanted ANYTHING to be completed. The rest wouldn’t be fixed as we didn’t specifically state a fuel leak on the form. Today we were told the repairs were completed. When Erik got there to pick up the truck he asked if they had driven it to see if the repairs had worked. The mechanic very bluntly stated that “no sir! With that fuel leak, we won’t even crank the truck much less drive it”.
Now, we are out $14,000 on a truck that is going to blow up at any minute. I contacted Heather and David today only to be told “sorry about that Mrs, Sears, we will not be having anything further to do with this truck, we kept our end of the deal”. To date the truck has 157,000 miles most of which were FROM KNOXVILLE!!

name: Thomas Boles
text: I bought a certified used truck (Freightliner 125) and picked it up in Miami. After 50 miles I stopped and the check engine light and stop engine lights came on  eventually the truck shut off. I was able to get it back to my base and called the warranty department concerning the problem. I took it to the Madison Alabama location to get it fixed. After 2 weeks I was able to get my truck back, however the problem still exists. It seems obvious to me that anything not causing a code to be generated isn’t looked at  I am very displeased with not only the repair but the fact that a “Certified” truck is in such bad condition. I will never buy another Ryder truck based on my experience with this on

I will never spend another dollar with U Save.

name: Eric D P
text: There could not possibly be a better storage unit service in the area. As a representative for a company who utilizes their storage units, I frequent this establishment and 100% of the time, they are incredibly accommodating, friendly, and they keep the whole building, restrooms included, pristine and highly presentable. It is climate controlled and therefore is always a nice escape from the terrible heat during the summer, as well as a guarantee that the items in your unit will never be exposed to unsuitable temperatures regardless of the outside weather. Additionally, they have implemented a motion detection system connected to their lights in an effort to conserve energy. When movement is detected, the lights for the specific area you are walking through illuminate. After a period of time during which the system detects no movement, the lights turn off and the building goes dark. Moreover on this, rather than movement causing the system to turn every light in the building on, it turns on only the necessary lights in the section in which you are moving. I cannot imagine having our company in any other storage unit facility. recommend this company. 6/5 stars!

name: J Brown
text:
Dozier brought to job site w leaking hydraulic fluid n rt track popping and flapping in need of a new sprocket we were told.  Another hydraulic line broke again 2 days later. The clacking got worse n louder.  The Dozier became harder to turn causing a slow down in work, additional time, labor hours, fuel, and double use of excavator to do Dozier work.  Finally, Dozier operator could not take the clanging noise nor fighting to barely turn Dozier and walked off the job Sun May 23, 2021 after struggling w Dozier for 5 days w no repair or replacement of it.
Also rental excavator started leaking hydraulic fluid at bucket on Sunday May 23, 2021 causing a shut down of operations.  Contacted United and 7:30 am.  No one responded till mid afternoon to replace hose. A couple of hours later hydraulic fluid leaking from same spot.  Called again around 4:30 pm.  Reluctantly, service man came back out.  It was discovered that he had not tightened the hose that he installed.  Hence the 2nd leak.

resp.text: Thanks, J. We have escalated to the local management team and hope to resolve the issue with you quickly. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to help in the meantime.

They had our phone number in the system and could have call ed if they had to go knowing we were going to show up. Had to go online and find another U-haul location before they closed because we needed to tow a car back home on Sunday. To write this review, I had to give them a 1 Star.

name: dustin villarreal
text:
The following is a description of a conversation I had over the phone with an employee at this U-Haul location:

Employee: HELLO! What you want?
Me: Uhh is this U-Haul?
Employee: Yeah... Wait.. Hold on!
Me: Okay..
Employee: What you want?
Me: Some pricing information.
Employee: (Loud conversation with another employee)... Yeah come on in.
Me: I would just like some information that's all.
Employee: You can make an appointment.
Me: What... I just need some info that's all.
Employee: Gotcha, come on in.
Me: Huh, uhh can you just tell me over the phone?
Employee: HOLD ON!
Me: What the crap......

Also helps that this place is only a 5 minute drive from my house. You also have 24/7 access to the place once you start renting. My brother and I have shopped around for different storage unit companies and I've gotta say you can definitely do much worse than Metro Mini. Thumbs up!

UPDATE: They decided to breach contract and revoke 24/7 access to all customers regardless when you signed up. Needless to say, we left.

text: My family has always used Long Lewis to rent our vehicles when we go on vacation. The vehicles are always so clean and you can tell they take great care of them. I put in a request over a month ago for a vehicle and no one ever called me. I called 3 times during this month of waiting, at different times of the day to make sure I wasn’t calling when they were busy, and they would never answer. I finally went up there and was told that the online rental tool is not a good tool. I do not think they should have the tool as an option if no one will call you back. Again, we have had great experiences with Long Lewis rental, but the customer service and follow up is always lacking.

resp.text: Cheyenne- we are terribly sorry for the experience you have had. We are unsure who told you this. Our rental manager, Jason, has reached out to you to correct this. We hope we can make this right. Thank you for letting us know how we are doing. Thank you!

It took 20 minutes to resolve but she still had given that advise. Ridiculous!

name: Anthony Bunger
text:
Tl;dr I moved from Glen Iris to Hueytown in a few hours and paid $150 for a 15’ truck.Conflicting information from representatives, stressful environment, overpriced. Moving is already stressful, and having to deal with people who want to make things harder is a no-go. I don’t plan on using uhaul again after my experience at this location.

Rented a truck from here on Saturday morning that was due back Sunday at a different location in ensley.

The woman working Saturday morning was helpful, and suggested returning the truck back at the same location because it might be cheaper for us, depending on the mileage and our specific situation.

We were done with the truck early, brought it back that night around 5 to a different uhaul rep (a man). While he was helping us, a different woman uhaul rep told us that we couldn’t return our truck to a different location than on our sheet because it would be more expensive, while the man smirked. Obviously I was confused. I was unable to contact the location that I was supposed to return the truck to (in ensley). When i told her the woman from the morning told us it would be cheaper and insisted she said “okay, charge him! Charge him!” I waited for a long time for her to direct the man in how to check my truck in, And eventually she went out to the vehicle and came back to show me $1,075 charge that would be applied If I returned the vehicle here. So After an hour and a half of run-around, intimidation, and waiting, I left to the place in ensley and returned my truck there, where no one was working (it was 6:20 pm) and left the keys in a box.

name: Lilly Putar
text: Whatever you do, do not hire top of the line moving and labor services to help you move. They do their business/evil through U-Haul and will damage your stuff when they move it. They will then follow that up by coming back to your property to destroy stuff. In my case, they broke into my car. Uhaul trucks are also terrible and mine overheated and killed my cat. I think its fair to say I hate U Haul.

name: Mandy Hunter
text: I typically do not write reviews about service, but the customer service with this company is TERRIBLE!!  We order items for insureds who have lost stuff in fires, hurricanes, thefts, etc.  XPO Logistics called our office about setting up a delivery of Serta mattress (we ordered from Sam's Club).  We gave them the insured phone # and told them that it would be best to call them directly.  They called us back 4 different times asking the same info.  I contacted them and looks like EVERY ONE we talked, all 5  times failed to put the correct # in the system and had not reached out to our insured about delivery.  This family went through a hurricane and XPO Logistics had their mattress for 3 plus weeks and failed to contact my customer and when I called I was told the 1st available delivery was 2 weeks out.  I explained this was not acceptable as we had given them the contact # 5 times and they failed to contact them.  I asked for a manager and was told the only way to contact them was by email (as it seems they send their customer service off-shore).  I gave Mal (XPO rep) my person cell # as I would not be in the office at 8 pm and needed this resolved.  NO CALL.  I called the next day and got the same story from Cissel and guess what NO CALL.  This company has horrible customer service and if you are a business who uses them to ship your product I would think twice as the customers on this side are receiving very poor service.

name: Krystal Hopkins
text: Nice and friendly staff

name: TaLandria Nation
text: Had storage for years. No problems!

name: LSMadison H
text: Horrible hours. If you work a job and need access to something in storage don't use this place

name: LSMadison H
text: Horrible hours. If you work a job and need access to something in storage don't use this place

text: Love them!

name: Tay Jackson
text: Great

name: Nati Pascual
text:
(Translated by Google) I like cell phones

(Original)
Me gusta los celulares

name: ladonna baggett
text: Great service, Honest people. My husband returned our rental van and left our children's birthday card in the van (with cash money in it). With our move and getting settled my husband forgot all about it. When we finally called just to see if they had found the card, the guy who answered the call said he had been holding the birthday card for us. It has literally been 3 months and they still held it for us. Not often are people honest when it comes to cash but he was and held it for 3months until we came back to get it.

name: Scott Plagmann
text: Superior service,reasonable prices

name: selling items
text: Had a rental through app and never again am I going there. Not only did i have to wait 45 min for the rental approval but I requested equipment and it was not there. In all, terrible service.

name: Kenneth Manning
text: Great place to store your stuff

name: Rob D.
text: Good customer service in Centerpoint.

name: Jody Brown
text: Words cannot describe the way I view this place.

name: Sherry Blackburn
text: The new owner Phillip Booke was very helpful & super nice.

name: Jeff Bradley
text: The last 3 times I went to get propane, no certified person was there to fill a tank. I also called the last two times prior to going and nobody answered the phone. Very disappointing!

resp.text: This site has new ownership as of 12/17/2019. We are sorry if you had a bad experience with the previous owners.

name: Greg Hatcher
text: Also Greyhound bus pickup location. Employee stays on phone constantly without paying attention to customers. Pick a different location if possible.

resp.text: This site has new ownership as of 12/17/2019. We are sorry if you had a bad experience with the previous owners and hope you give us a new chance.

name: virginia berry
text: Nice

name: Bobby Garrett
text: Excellent service from this dealer, very polite, well informed on the equipment, fair price.

resp.text: Thank you for the review

name: Ronnie Ridlon
text: Wanted to share my experience with United rentals in Foley Alabama. Absolutely amazing, every single person I deal with is awesome and extremely helpful! But I have to give the biggest thanks & Recognition to Sara Polansky! She is amazing, gets whatever I need no matter the hurtles. Always comes though with perfect service!  Great company and people I highly recommend them for anything you can rent.

resp.text: Thanks for the shout-out, Ronnie. We appreciate the feedback and hope we can help out again soon.

name: Jimmy Chivers
text: I always receive the best service when I rent a piece of equipment. The people are very helpful and friendly.

name: John Jr Blacksher
text: When I pull in the yard, I never have to wait more than a minute to get waited on. Got to keep my head on a swivel because someone will be coming soon on a forklift to get the trailer off or to unload my truck.

resp.text: Thanks, John. Looking forward to working together again soon.

name: Kevin Maxwell
text: Sales associate(Angie) from the Pensacola Branch has been a pleasure to work with. She always takes care of me and all rentals set up for delivery and pick up with no issues.

resp.text: Thanks, Kevin. We appreciate the positive feedback and shout-out for our team. We're glad we were able to help you with your equipment needs and look forward to working together again soon.

name: Tim Simpson
text: Great place to rent equipment, very friendly staff.

resp.text: Thanks, Tim. We appreciate the feedback and your business. Let us know if there's anything we can do to help in the future.

name: Jake Plash
text:
Nice staff, very knowledgeable. There is this one mechanic named Jon, he went out of his way to help my crew understand the machine we picked up. We asked every question possible and he never once brushed us off or got irritated with us(and it was hot out). You don’t get many people that are so knowledgeable and professional. We will come
back just for that one mechanic alone. Good job United

name: Jeff Devine
text: GREAT SERVICE

resp.text: Thanks, Jeff. We appreciate the positive feedback and shout-out for our team. Let us know if we can help out again soon.

name: Angela Wingard
text: Very professional staff. They are always ready to help. The whole team seems to work well together. I love hearing around town how reliable United’s machines are. Great company to help with all your jobs, big or small!
